page.title: 05ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH.
page.content:
There has been a church on the site of St. Andrew's Church in Burnham since before 1316 when the present church was built. It is called St. Andrew's because it is in the diocese of Wells and because it is right next to the sea.
The tower on the church leans slightly, much to the alarm of visitors, who often telephone the vicar to inform him about it, but as it has been leaning since very shortly after it was built and has not moved since we are sure that it is safe.
There are some beautiful statues in the church which were designed by Sir Christopher Wren for Westminster Abbey. They were carved by Grinling Gibbons.
